text:
Thank you for the answer.

One more question-  can we use the same domain for the website pages and Landing pages?

Hello <@U070KQ765CK> ,
Yes, You can use the same domain for both website and landing pages. And you can do that inside the Settings > Content > Domain's  & URLs.

Either use the Forms API or a use the identify function of the Tracking Code API paired with either the `trackPageView` or `trackCustomBehavioralEvent` JS. 

In either of those cases, you’ll need some JavaScript on the page to fire after formsubmit but before redirect of the visitor.

• tracking code api docs - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code>
• Create manually tracked events <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/create-custom-behavioral-events-with-the-code-wizard|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/create-custom-behavioral-events-with-the-code-wizard>
• Forms API docs - <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form|https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
Here are a few resources I’ve created to show these items:
• Submit Forms API with JS <https://gist.github.com/robertainslie/b110b8275beee1b27255c4d6e2ba2e8c|https://gist.github.com/robertainslie/b110b8275beee1b27255c4d6e2ba2e8c>
• Fire a custom event with identify call <https://codepen.io/rainslie/pen/OJjdeBQ?editors=1010|https://codepen.io/rainslie/pen/OJjdeBQ?editors=1010> 
    ◦ Note - this includes the tracking code for my personal test account, 
you’ll need to swap the tracking code to your own and create the event in HS if you wanted to fork it

Thank you in advance

Hi all, not sure which channel is appropriate here but I am trying to find a solution to creating historical view of data from Snowflake Data Share using object properties history table. I have to perform some sort of pivot but it's not working as I expected. Has anyone had any luck with achieving a flattened version of the history table?

while this could be done from a technical perspective it would require quite a lot of effort/time. Is there a reason, why you don't want to build your staging pages with <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging|content staging>?

<@U06RQGQ27A6> I haven’t done this specific thing, but I’m personally interested in the topic. 

Want to share more context about what you hope the end result looks like and the SQL?
Ahh thanks <@U8249TTCK>! I'll give this a try
<@U8249TTCK> just DM’ed you a few questions when you have a moment. Thanks!
What email client is being used?

Hi everyone, I'm having some problems with UTM tracking on HubSpot, I wanna track my Google search campaigns using the URL given below, can you please help me see if there is any issue with my UTM parameters. (I added tracking parameters for Hyros and HubSpot)

<https://www.automatedretailcommerce.com/w-amazon-website-application?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign={campaignid}&utm_term={keyword}&utm_content={adgroupid}&device={device}&hyros_id={_hy_session_id}&hyros_campaign={{campaign.name}}&hyros_adset={{adset.name}}&hyros_ad={{ad.name}}&__hstc=tracking_id&__hssc=session_info&__hsfp=visitor_id&gclid={gclid}>

Sure. Let's take OBJECTS_TASKS as an example.

What I am trying to achieve is a log table that essentially looks like this:
```OBJECTID	SUBJECT	STATUS	   TYPE	    CREATED_AT	        UPDATEDAT	         INGESTEDAT
1234566	   Example	COMPLETED	CALL	2024-05-28 5:43:02	2024-05-30 22:00:32	2024-05-30 22:00:32
1234566	   Example	NOT STARTED	CALL	2024-05-28 5:43:02	2024-05-29 0:00:00	2024-05-29 0:00:00```
At the moment, OBJECTS_TASKS is only shows current values as of last ingested time. This means if you don't have a frequent snapshot running based on last ingestedat timestamp from your target model, you may miss changes.

So, ideally, using the OBJECT_PROPERTIES_HISTORY, I was hoping to achieve the above which is showing 1 task, and it's transition from NOT STARTED to COMPLETED.

The issue here is that the OBJECT_PROPERTIES_HISTORY table, would only provide the following when the status changes:
```OBJECTID	NAME	         VALUE	   	INGESTEDAT
1234566	   HS_TASK_STATUS	COMPLETED	2024-05-30 22:00:32```
In this simple example, the solution is simply, I can just track changes of only that column however, in scenarios where there will be multiple columns changes at different times, I would have to create tracking statements for each column.

Ideally, the history table shows the snapshot at row level for the entire object as the first example I provided.

If the OBJECTS_TASKS was a materialised table rather than a view, this wouldn't be an issue as I could set up a stream on the table to track changes and use that to create a log provided that change track was enabled for the table.

Hi Folks! How we can set lead scoring for blog page via this new feature "Lead Score" - <https://app.HubSpot.com/lead-scoring/691534/manage>
I would like to set up lead scoring on all the blog pages. Our website is built on HubSpot CMS. Please help.
